DataElement.preferredName: Superficial Incision Surgical Site Infection Characteristic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The class of infections that occur within 30 days after surgery where the infection involves only skin or subcutaneous tissue of the incision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Consisting of or containing pus; associated with the formation of or caused by pus.

Concepts.definition: Pus-containing fluid that is draining from an orifice or wound.

PermissibleValues.value: Organisms isolated from an aseptically obtained culture

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgeon Open Positive Finding Superficial Incision
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: An incision that involves only the skin or subcutaneous tissue.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
An incision that involves only the skin or subcutaneous tissue.
